sen.j: 京極 高倍（きょうごく たかます、文化 (元号)5年（1808年）- 天保4年12月5日 (旧暦)（1834年1月14日））は、丹後国峰山藩の第8代藩主。
sen.e: Takamasu KYOGOKU (born in 1808 and died on January 14, 1834) was the eight lord of Mineyama Domain in the Tango Province.
Takamasu KYOGOKU (1808-January 14, 1834) was the eighth lord of Mineyama Domain in Tango Province.
Takamasu KYOGOKU (1808-January 14, 1834) was the eighth lord of Mineyama Domain in Tango Province.

sen.j: 第7代藩主・京極高備の五男。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of Takamasa KYOGOKU, the seventh lord.
He was the fifth son of Takamasa KYOGOKU, the seventh lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: 文末に of the domain を追記しました。
sen.e: He was the fifth son of Takamasa KYOGOKU, the seventh lord of the domain.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、備前国守。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Military Governor of Bizen Province.
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and he was the Governor of Bizen Province.
sen.cmt: Military を he was the に修正しました。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and he was the Governor of Bizen Province.
He was called Manzo in his childhood.
His childhood name was Manzo.
His childhood name was Manzo.

sen.j: 長兄の京極高寧と次兄の京極高聡は早世し、三兄と四兄は他家の養子に出されていた。
sen.e: His oldest brother, Takayasu KYOGOKU and his second oldest brother Takatoshi KYOGOKU died an early death and the third and forth oldest brothers were adopted into other families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: His oldest brother, Takayasu KYOGOKU and his second oldest brother Takatoshi KYOGOKU died early and the third and forth oldest brothers were adopted into other families.
sen.cmt: died an early death を died early に修正しました。
sen.e: His oldest brother, Takayasu KYOGOKU and his second oldest brother Takatoshi KYOGOKU died early and the third and forth oldest brothers were adopted into other families.

sen.j: そのため、五男であったが、高倍は天保3年（1832年）11月20日、父の隠居により家督を継いで藩主となった。
sen.e: Therefore, although he was the fifth son, he succeeded to the family name and became the lord of the Domain on November 20, 1832 when his father retired.
sen.cmt: 一原文一翻訳の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, although he was the fifth son, he succeeded to the family name and became the lord of the Domain on December 11, 1832 when his father retired.
sen.cmt: November 20 を December 11 に修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, although he was the fifth son, he succeeded to the family name and became the lord of the Domain on December 11, 1832 when his father retired.

sen.j: しかし在位1年あまりの翌年12月5日に26歳の若さで死去した。
sen.e: However, on December 5, 1833, he died at the early age of 26 after being on the throne only for one and a few months.
However, on January 14, 1834, he died early at the age of 26 only after a year and a month of reign.
However, on January 14, 1834, he died early at the age of 26, having reigned for just over a year.

sen.j: 嗣子が無く、後を弟の京極高鎮が継いだ。
sen.e: He had no legitimate son, so, his younger brother, Takatsune KYOGOKU succeeded to the family name.
Since he had no legitimate son, his younger brother Takatsune KYOGOKU succeeded to the family name.
sen.cmt: 文頭に Since を追記し、文中の so を削除しました。
sen.e: Since he had no legitimate son, his younger brother Takatsune KYOGOKU succeeded to the family name.

sen.j: 法号：徳彰院興誉和順道融。
sen.e: Hogo (the name given by the Buddhist monk): Tokushoinkoyowajundoyu
sen.cmt: 徳彰院興誉和順道融 はすべて音読みにしました
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name: Tokushoinkoyowajundoyu.
sen.cmt: Hogo (the name given by the Buddhist monk) を His posthumous Buddhist name に修正しました。文末にピリオドを追記しました。
sen.e: His posthumous Buddhist name: Tokushoinkoyowajundoyu.
